items.description: Sal solves a word problem about the combined pool-filling rates of two water hoses, by creating a rational equation that models the situation. The equation has a solution that is eliminated due to the context.

items.title: Reasoning about unknown variables
items.description: Sal solves the following challenge: Given that a>0, b<0, and a/b>a*b, what further can we learn about the variables?

items.title: Reasoning about unknown variables: divisibility
items.description: Sal solves the following challenge: Given the positive integers a, b, and c, where a is a multiple of c and (a+b)/c is an integer. Is b necessarily a multiple of c?

items.title: Structure in rational expression
items.description: Analyzing an elaborate rational expression to determine what's bigger: the value of that expression at some unknown c, or the number of times the expression is equal to 0? This is algebraic reasoning at its best!

items.title: Multiplying & dividing rational expressions: monomials
items.description: Sal multiplies (6x³/5) X (2/3x) and divides (2x⁴/7) ➗ (5x⁴/4).

items.title: Multiplying rational expressions
items.description: Learn how to find the product of two rational expressions.

items.title: Dividing rational expressions
items.description: Learn how to find the quotient of two rational expressions.

items.title: Multiply & divide rational expressions: Error analysis
items.description: Analyze other people's attempts to multiply and divide rational expressions, and identify the mistake they made.

items.title: Multiplying rational expressions
items.description: Sal multiplies and simplifies (a²-4)/(a²-1) X (a+1)/(a+2).

items.title: Dividing rational expressions
items.description: Sal divides and simplifies (2p+6)/(p+5) ➗ (10)/(4p+20).

items.title: Multiply & divide rational expressions
items.description: Example: Multiply and simplify (a²-4)/(a²-1) X (a+1)/(a+2).

items.title: Multiplying rational expressions: multiple variables
items.description: Sal multiplies and simplifies (3x²y)/(2ab) X (14a²b)/(18xy²).

items.title: Dividing rational expressions: unknown expression
items.description: Sal finds the polynomial D for which (20y²-80)/D ÷ (4y²-8y)/(y³+9y²)=1 is true for all values of y for which it's defined.

items.title: Multiply & divide rational expressions (advanced)
items.description: Example: Multiply and simplify (3x²y)/(2ab) X (14a²b)/(18xy²).

items.title: Adding & subtracting rational expressions: like denominators
items.description: Sal adds 6/(2x²-7) + (-3x-8)/(2x²-7) and subtracts (9x²+3)/(14x²-9) - (-3x²+5)/(14x²-9).

items.title: Intro to adding & subtracting rational expressions
items.description: Learn how to add or subtract two rational expressions into a single expression.

items.title: Add & subtract rational expressions: like denominators
items.description: Example: Add and simplify 6/(2x²-7) + (-3x-8)/(2x²-7).

items.title: Intro to adding rational expressions with unlike denominators
items.description: Sal rewrites a/b+c/d as a single rational expression.

items.title: Adding rational expression: unlike denominators
items.description: Learn how to add rational expressions with different denominators by finding a common denominator, multiplying the numerators and denominators by the same factors, and simplifying the result. A rational expression is a fraction with polynomials in the numerator and denominator.

items.title: Add & subtract rational expressions (basic)
items.description: Add and subtract rational expressions whose denominators don't have any shared factors.

items.title: Subtracting rational expressions: factored denominators
items.description: Sal subtracts two rational expressions whose denominators are factored. The denominators aren't the same but they share a factor.

items.title: Least common multiple of polynomials
items.description: Sal finds the least common multiple (LCM) of 3z³-6z²-9z and 7z⁴+21z³+14z².

items.title: Adding & subtracting rational expressions
items.description: Have you learned the basics of rational expression addition/subtraction? Great! Now dig deeper with some advanced examples.

items.title: Add & subtract rational expressions: factored denominators
items.description: Example: Add and simplify x/(2x+1)(x-7) + 2x²/(2x-3)(x-7).

items.title: Subtracting rational expressions
items.description: Sal subtracts and simplifies (a-2)/(a+2) - (a-3)/(a²+4a+4).

items.title: Add & subtract rational expressions
items.description: Add and subtract rational expressions. The denominators in this exercise may have shared factors, and so require finding the least common multiple before adding or subtracting.
